Wire App Analysis・Dependencies

Android

iOS

According to Wire's wiki the app for iOS has some dependencies that are available from Cartage. This dependencies are from Wire and provides different services to the main app. The main dependencies are described below.

One of the most important dependencies is wire-ios-transport, which abstracts the network communication with Wire's backend. It handles authentication of requests, network failures and retries transparently. This has nearly 84% of the code in Objective-c.

Wire has another dependencie called Cryptobox, that provides a high-level API with persistent storage for the proteus implementation of the axolotl protocol. The version of iOS is made in a big part in Swift (~78%).

Wire data model dependency is a CoreData-based storage library and implements the application data model and status observation. This dependency has the big part if its code in Swift (~65%) and the remaining part in Objective-c.

Finally, Wire has a dependency called Sync Engine and is the entry point for the application. Integrates the functions of other frameworks. Responsible for:

  • Integration of other frameworks with UI app.
  • Integration of AVS.
  • Push Notifications.
  • High-level sync logic.
  • Events processing.
